triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value exceeds policy limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 100% for Tier B applicants. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 102.5%, which exceeds this limit.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The calculated Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the policy limit for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 100% for Tier A applicants. The calculated LTV is 91.11%, which is within the acceptable range.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The calculated Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the policy limit for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider adjusting the loan terms or verifying income to ensure compliance with the DTI policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 45% for Tier A applicants. The calculated DTI is 41.25%, which is within the acceptable range.

content.reasoning: The proposal was analyzed against the underwriting policy, focusing on credit score, loan-to-value ratio, and debt-to-income ratio. The applicant's credit score qualifies for Tier A, allowing for a maximum LTV of 100% and a DTI of 45%. The calculated LTV is 91.11%, which is within the acceptable range, and the DTI is 41.25%, also within the acceptable range. No policy violations were identified.
